perturbation.original_text: 1.1. License. Subject to the terms and conditions of this Agreement, Licensor hereby grants to Licensee, and Licensee hereby accepts from Licensor, a personal, non-exclusive, royalty-free right and license to use the Licensed Mark solely and exclusively as a component of Licensee’s own corporate name and in connection with marketing the investment management, investment consultation and investment advisory services that Investment Advisor may provide to Licensee. During the term of this Agreement, Licensee shall use the Licensed Mark only to the extent permitted under this License, and except as provided above, neither Licensee nor any affiliate, owner, director, officer, employee or agent thereof shall otherwise use the Licensed Mark or any derivative thereof in the Territory without the prior express written consent of Licensor in its sole and absolute discretion and shall not use the Licensed Mark for any purpose outside the Territory. All rights not expressly granted to Licensee hereunder shall remain the exclusive property of the Licensor.
perturbation.changed_text: 1.1. License. Subject to the terms and conditions of this Agreement, Licensor hereby grants to Licensee, and Licensee hereby accepts from Licensor, a personal, non-exclusive, royalty-free right and license to use the Licensed Mark as a component of Licensee’s own corporate name and in connection with the operation of its business. During the term of this Agreement, Licensee may use the Licensed Mark to the extent permitted under this License, and neither Licensee nor any affiliate, owner, director, officer, employee or agent thereof may use the Licensed Mark or any derivative thereof in the Territory without the prior express written consent of Licensor in its sole and absolute discretion and shall not use the Licensed Mark for any purpose outside the Territory. All rights not expressly granted to Licensee hereunder shall remain the exclusive property of the Licensor.
perturbation.explanation: The original text restricts the use of the Licensed Mark to 'solely and exclusively' being a component of Licensee’s own corporate name and in connection with marketing investment services. The modified text broadens this by removing 'solely and exclusively' and changing 'marketing the investment management, investment consultation and investment advisory services that Investment Advisor may provide to Licensee' to 'in connection with the operation of its business', this expands the permitted uses, potentially conflicting with other clauses defining acceptable use and creating ambiguity.

perturbation.original_text: 4.1. Term. This Agreement shall expire if the Investment Advisor or one of its affiliates ceases to serve as investment adviser to the Licensee. This Agreement shall be terminable by Licensor at any time and in its sole discretion in the event that Licensor or Licensee receives notice of any Third Party Claim arising out of Licensee’s use of the Licensed Mark; by Licensor or Licensee upon sixty (60) days’ written notice to the other party; or by Licensee at any time in the event Licensee assigns or attempts to assign or sublicense this Agreement or any of Licensee’s rights or duties hereunder without the prior written consent of Licensor.
perturbation.changed_text: 4.1. Term. This Agreement shall expire if the Investment Advisor ceases to serve as investment adviser to the Licensee. This Agreement shall be terminable by Licensor at any time and in its sole discretion in the event that Licensor or Licensee receives notice of any Third Party Claim arising out of Licensee’s use of the Licensed Mark; by Licensor or Licensee upon sixty (60) days’ written notice to the other party; or by Licensee at any time in the event Licensee assigns or attempts to assign or sublicense this Agreement or any of Licensee’s rights or duties hereunder without the prior written consent of Licensor.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states that the agreement expires if 'the Investment Advisor or one of its affiliates ceases to serve'. The modified text removes 'or one of its affiliates', narrowing the condition for expiration. This creates a contradiction because, under the modified text, if an affiliate of the Investment Advisor is still serving as investment advisor, the agreement could be argued to remain in effect, even if the original Investment Advisor ceases to serve. This ambiguity impacts the termination rights and obligations.

perturbation.original_text: 5.1. Third Party Beneficiaries. The parties agree that Investment Advisor shall be a third party beneficiary of this Agreement, and shall have the rights and protections provided to Licensee under this Agreement. Nothing in this Agreement, either express or implied, is intended to or shall confer upon any third party other than Investment Advisor any legal or equitable right, benefit or remedy of any nature whatsoever under or by reason of this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: 5.1. Third Party Beneficiaries. The parties agree that Investment Advisor shall be a third party beneficiary of this Agreement, and shall have the rights and protections provided to Licensee under this Agreement. Nothing in this Agreement, either express or implied, is intended to or shall confer upon any third party any legal or equitable right, benefit or remedy of any nature whatsoever under or by reason of this Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: The original text clearly states that no third party *other than* Investment Advisor is intended to receive any legal or equitable right. By removing the phrase 'other than Investment Advisor', the revised clause implies that *no* third party, including the Investment Advisor itself, is intended to be a beneficiary. This directly contradicts the first part of the sentence which explicitly names Investment Advisor as a third-party beneficiary.
